summary.overview: This web application is a custom video player that allows users to play, pause, skip, adjust volume, change playback speed, seek using a progress bar, and toggle fullscreen mode. The interface is designed to provide intuitive controls for video playback.
summary.predefined_options: Predefined options include default values for volume (1.0), playback rate (1.0), and progress bar starting at 0%. Skip buttons are preset to skip -10 seconds backward and 25 seconds forward. Structurally, the player consists of a container element (.player) that wraps both the video playback area and the control interface, and a video element (.player__video.viewer) where the actual playback occurs.

requirements.description: When the user clicks on the video or the Play/Pause button, the video should toggle between play and pause states. The Play/Pause button icon should update to '►' for play and '❚ ❚' for pause.
When the user clicks the Skip Backward button, the video should rewind by 10 seconds. When the user clicks the Skip Forward button, the video should fast-forward by 25 seconds.
When the user adjusts the Volume slider, the video's audio level should update to match the slider value, ranging from 0 (mute) to 1 (maximum volume).
When the user adjusts the Playback Rate slider, the video's playback speed should update to match the slider value, ranging from 0.5x (half speed) to 2x (double speed).
The progress bar should visually represent the current playback position as a percentage of the video's duration. The progress bar fill should update dynamically as the video plays.
When the user clicks or drags on the progress bar, the video should seek to the corresponding playback position based on the click or drag location.
When the user clicks the Fullscreen button, the video player should toggle between fullscreen mode and normal mode.
When the user clicks and holds the mouse on the progress bar and moves it, the video should seek dynamically to the corresponding playback position until the mouse is released.
